metadata.title: CVE-2024-41011 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amdkfd: don't allow mapping the MMIO HDP page with large pagesWe don't get the right offset in that case.  The GPU hasan unused 4K area of the register BAR space into which you canremap registers.  We remap the HDP flush registers into thisspace to allow userspace (CPU or GPU) to flush the HDP when itupdates VRAM.  However, on systems with >4K pages, we end upexposing PAGE_SIZE of MMIO space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-41011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
